Package com.github.chrisblutz.breadboard.ui.toolkit.builtin.input

  • Method Details

    • getValidationRegex

      String getValidationRegex()
      Spinners use this method to retrieve the regular expression that should be used to validate the input to the internal text field. Any input that does not match this regular expression will be invalidated and not allowed.

      A value of null indicates that all input should be accepted.

      Returns:
      The regular expression that validates input to the spinner, or null if all input should be accepted.

    • getClampToMinimum

      boolean getClampToMinimum(T minimum)
      Spinners use this method to determine if the text field should prevent entry of values less than the minimum value.

      For example, an integer spinner with a minimum value of -10 might clamp to that value, preventing users from entering anything less than -10 (e.g., a user could not type another 1 after typing -1, as that would yield -11).

      However, it might not always be preferable. For example, an integer spinner with a minimum value of 2 but a maximum of 100 would not want this, as it would prevent users from entering a 1 (since 1 is less than the minimum). Thus, users would not be able to type anything starting with a 1 (such as 10).

      This method will never be called with a null minimum, as spinners without a minimum cannot clamp to the minimum.

      Parameters:
      minimum - the minimum value for the spinner
      Returns:
      true if the spinner should clamp to the minimum, false otherwise

    • getClampToMaximum

      boolean getClampToMaximum(T maximum)
      Spinners use this method to determine if the text field should prevent entry of values greater than the maximum value.

      For example, an integer spinner with a maximum value of 10 might clamp to that value, preventing users from entering anything larger than 10 (e.g., a user could not type another 1 after typing 1, as that would yield 11).

      However, it might not always be preferable. For example, an integer spinner with a maximum value of -2 but a minimum of -100 would not want this, as it would prevent users from entering a -1 (since -1 is greater than the maximum). Thus, users would not be able to type anything starting with a -1 (such as -10).

      This method will never be called with a null maximum, as spinners without a maximum cannot clamp to the maximum.

      Parameters:
      maximum - the maximum value for the spinner
      Returns:
      true if the spinner should clamp to the maximum, false otherwise

    • getDefaultValue

      T getDefaultValue(T minimum, T maximum)
      Spinners use this method to determine the default value to assign to a spinner of this type. This method may not return null, as spinners require a non-null default value.
      Parameters:
      minimum - the minimum value set for the spinner, or null if there isn't one
      maximum - the maximum value set for the spinner, or null if there isn't one
      Returns:
      The non-null default value for spinners of this type

    • getDefaultMinimum

      T getDefaultMinimum()

    • getDefaultMaximum

      T getDefaultMaximum()

    • getValue

      T getValue(String string)
      Spinners use this method to get the actual value of the string entered into the text area. For example, an integer handler that receives "1" would return 1.

      If the string passed to this method is not a valid representation of the type this handler handles, this method should return null. This tells the spinner that the entered value was invalid.

      Parameters:
      string - the string representation from the text field
      Returns:
      The actual value represented by the string, or null if the string does not represent a valid value

    • getString

      String getString(T value)
